intro: Hieracium juranum var. constrictiforme, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, reaching heights of up to 60 cm. The plant features basal and alternate leaves that are narrowly elliptic to linear in shape. Its flowers are yellow, with a central disk surrounded by ray florets, and it blooms from June to September. It is characterized by its distinctive leaf morphology and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
